metadata.title: CVE-2020-6798 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
If a template tag was used in a select tag, the parser could be confused and allow JavaScript parsing and execution when it should not be allowed. A site that relied on the browser behaving correctly could suffer a cross-site scripting vulnerability as a result. In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in the Thunderbird product because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.5, Firefox < 73, and Firefox < ESR68.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-6798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
